name: cutaway
content:
cutaway noun [C]
(IN FILM)
Add to word list
Add to word list
an occasion when a piece of film or an image showing a different subject or person is shown during a film, television programme, etc.: There are occasional cutaways to the interviewer smiling or nodding. The film has a documentary look, with unsteady camera shots and quick cutaways.
More examplesFewer examplesThe story is told in a rather random way, with sudden cutaways to irrelevant characters.We love our shows to have a fast pace, interesting cutaways, and funny music.The video simply features the band playing the song from beginning to end, with no cutaways.Her family was the subject of several camera cutaways during the speech.

cutaway noun [C]
(PICTURE)
a picture of something with some outer parts not included so that you can see the inside: The sketch shows a cutaway of a Georgian house. To explain how the mechanism works, we really need a cutaway.
part of a picture or piece of material that has been cut away to form a hole: The report is in a card folder with a cutaway so you can see the title page.
More examplesFewer examplesCutaways show how Roman buildings were constructed and what people did inside them. The image is framed within a curved oblong hole, as if seen through a cutaway in a book cover.

cutaway noun [C]
(GUITAR)
music
  specialized a guitar that is designed with a space at the top of its body on one side of the neck (= long narrow part), or the space itself: She usually plays an electro-acoustic cutaway. Guitars without a cutaway tend to have a fuller sound.
More examplesFewer examplesA cutaway is slightly lighter and easier to handle for some players.It is easier to reach the higher frets on a guitar with a cutaway.

cutaway noun [C]
(CLOTHES)
a coat or jacket that is short at the front and long at the back, usually worn for formal occasions: I love the velvet blazers and cutaways. The groom wore a cutaway with a bright red pocket handkerchief.

cutaway adjective [before noun]
(FILM)
(of an image or short piece of film) shown during a film, television programme, etc. and having a different subject to the main subject: There will be no cutaway shots of a candidate while his or her opponent is speaking.
More examplesFewer examplesThe player's wife was seen to react in cutaway shots during the coverage.We will show comments from the public in a cutaway section.

cutaway adjective [before noun]
(PICTURE)
(of a picture or model) with some outer parts not included so that you can see the inside: The cutaway diagram shows the virus with its protein spikes on the outer layer, an intermediate layer and the inner layer containing RNA. There was a cutaway picture showing the inside of the reactor.
More examplesFewer examplesOnly half the ship was recovered, which made a spectacular display like a giant cutaway diagram.The cutaway model shows where an electrical cable can be plugged in to charge batteries in the hybrid vehicle.

cutaway adjective [before noun]
(CLOTHES)
(of a coat or jacket) short at the front and long at the back, and usually worn for formal occasions : He wears a formal black cutaway coat and trousers.
a piece of clothing designed with parts cut out of it so that it has holes or is shorter than you would expect: One popular version of the cutaway swimsuit is the one-strap. I like the black velvet dress with cutaway shoulders.
More examplesFewer examplesThe bosses are invariably depicted wearing old-fashioned cutaway coats and spats.A cutaway collar complements a tie with a chunky knot.She wore a pink shirt with cutaway sleeves.Tina went for stylish cropped trousers and a cutaway T-shirt.

cutaway adjective [before noun]
(GUITAR)
A cutaway guitar is designed with a space at the top of its body on one side of the neck (= long narrow part): There are advantages and disadvantages to a cutaway guitar.
More examplesFewer examplesShe bought a cutaway steel-string acoustic.
